intro: Claytonia porsildii, commonly known as the Porsild's spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are succulent and often have a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in its cold, dry habitat. Claytonia porsildii is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
